ThingDef.label: pickles
ThingDef.description:
Crisp vegetables preserved in a vinegar solution, pickles develop a tangy, salty, and sometimes spicy flavor through fermentation or soaking.

<color=#E5E54C>Trade considerations:</color>

<color=#E5E54C>Ingredients:</color> Making 25 pickles requires produce and vinegar for a total value of 115, and sells for 15, giving a <color=#33CC33>69.33%</color> profit per unit.

<color=#E5E54C>Value per work:</color> Recipe requires 1000 work, which results on a value per work of <color=#33CC33>0.38</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Caravan trading:</color> Its weight is 0.2 Kg, for a value per Kg of <color=#33CC33>75</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Profit per day:</color> On average, profit per day is <color=#33CC33>0.50</color> (for reference Yayo is 0.35).

ThingDef.label: pickled eggs
ThingDef.description:
This process transforms boiled eggs into tangy, flavorful snacks by immersing them in a brine of vinegar. Over time, the eggs absorb the brine’s sharp flavors, creating a delicious, protein-rich treat. This kills the chicken.

<color=#E5E54C>Trade considerations:</color>

<color=#E5E54C>Ingredients:</color> Making 20 pickled eggs requires unfertilized eggs and vinegar for a total value of 95, and sells for 7, giving a <color=#33CC33>32.14%</color> profit per unit.

<color=#E5E54C>Value per work:</color> Recipe requires 1000 work, which results on a value per work of <color=#33CC33>0.14</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Caravan trading:</color> Its weight is 0.2 Kg, for a value per Kg of <color=#33CC33>35</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Profit per day:</color> On average, profit per day is <color=#33CC33>0.34</color> (for reference Yayo is 0.35).
